request.description: When the order is scheduled successfully, the ride_id is returned.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description:
Get the details for the scheduled ride.

When the ride is converted to on-demand, this endpoint will start returning 404.

Not intended for frequent polling.

response.name: OK

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description:
Returns an array of estimations for different categories. One of the `vehicle_category_id` of the categories should be provided when creating the scheduled order in order for the price to be fixed before the ride.

The request needs to contain at least 2 stops, and can contain up to 4. The first stop is going to be used as the pickup point, and the last as the destination.

All the categories available for the city will be returned; however, you will not have ETA information, unlike on demand estimations.

response.name: OK

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description: The response will be empty in case of a successful cancellation.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description:
Returns the list of all scheduled rides that were not yet handled, made by the API client, sorted ascending by the `arrive_at_client_time`.

The response is paginated.

response.name: OK

The request needs to contain at least 2 stops, and can contain up to 4. The first stop is going to be used as the pickup point, and the last as the destination.

All the categories available for the city will be returned; however, you will not have ETA information, unlike on demand estimations.

response.name: OK

request.description:
When the order is created successfully, the `ride_id` should be saved for tracking the ride later.

The stops information should be identical to the estimation query from which the `fare_id` is gathered.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description:
When the ride is found with the given `ride_id`, this is the response that you are going to see.

Depending on the state of the ride, some information might not be available, such as ETA and vehicle information.

Not intended for frequent polling.

response.name: OK

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description:
Returns an array of estimations for different categories. One of the `fare_id` of the categories should be provided when creating the order in order for the price to be fixed before the ride.

The request needs to contain at least 2 stops, and can contain up to 4. The first stop is going to be used as the pickup point, and the last as the destination.

All the categories available for the city will be returned. The `eta` property might be null in case all the drivers of a category are busy and booking a new ride is impossible at the moment.

response.name: OK

request.description:
This is the main endpoint that needs to be polled frequently in order to keep track of the driver.

If called for a non-active ride, will return an error.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description:
The price breakdown for the ride is provided with this endpoint, after the ride finishes.

There might be some delay between the time the ride finishes and this information is available.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description:
The response will be empty in case of a successful deletion.

Depending on when the ride is cancelled, a cancellation fee may occur.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description:
Returns the list of all rides made by the API client sorted descending by the date it was created.

The response is paginated.

response.name: OK

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

item.name: 8 - Change state - CLIENT DID NOT SHOW

request.description:
Returns an array of estimations per category x payment method. One of the `fare_id` of the categories should be provided when creating the order in order for the price and payment method to be fixed before the ride.

The request needs to contain at least 2 stops, and can contain up to 4. The first stop is going to be used as the pickup point, and the last as the destination.

The payment methods that needs to be provided request is an array, which can contain "business", "cash" or "card". The returned estimations will be per the provided payment methods.

All the categories available for the city will be returned. The `eta` property might be null in case all the drivers of a category are busy and booking a new ride is impossible at the moment.

response.name: OK

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic
